pages.text: After all of that simple to-do list from the previous entry, you will have a general idea on what to do. This part of the book is about anything else you might find useful to know. It could be crafting stations, items, or gear! $(br2)Just don't say $(o)[The guidebook didn't mention this item]$(), the publisher is sick and tired of hearing about it!

Remember to assess your surroundings. $(br2)What biomes are you currently nearby? Are you near a desert, forest, or ocean? $(br)What are you food options? Are they hunting, farming, or fishing? $(br)Is there a reliable source of raw materials? Components such as ores, stone, wood, and sand. $(br)What is the climate like in the area? Cold, hot, or wet?

These are things you should be asking yourself on your first few days. Unless you're already doing it! That's amazing wanderer! Look at you, already a veteran in the making. Arms Master Vendrick would be quite proud of you and your companions. $(br2)$(n)Anyways, here are some recipes you should consider on your adventure:

$(n)Assess your surroundings:$()$(br) $(li)If there is a forest nearby then try to get a sizeable amount of lumber to build yourself tools and other materials. $(br2)$(li)If you are in a tundra immediately look for ways to keep warm. Try a campfire and stay underground. $(br2)$(li)If you stuck in the desert, then immediately look for a water source to stay cool and quench your thirst.

Please DO NOT terrorize or disturb the peaceful villagers. It is not in your best interest to anger them, otherwise you will be attacked on sight. $(br2)Lastly, only quitters will try to $(k)rebirth $()again for a better start in their journey. Just tough it up and do your best to survive. Whatever doesn't kill you makes you... wait... nevermind.

pages.title: A peaceful village!
pages.text: Stop bothering them! It's not free stuff!
